import React from 'react' import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag' import { Playground, PropsTable } from 'docz' import { Button } from '../../src/components/Button/' import GlobalStyle from '../../src/Utils/GlobalStyle.js' import theme from '../../src/Utils/Theme.js' import styled, { ThemeProvider } from 'styled-components' import HotelTheme from '../../src/Utils/HotelTheme.js' const layoutProps = { }; export default class MDXContent extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.layout = null } render() { const { components, ...props } = this.props return {`Theming`} {`import {Grid, Col, Row} from 'react-styled-flexboxgrid'`} {`Introduction`} {``}{` returns its children when rendering, so it must only wrap a single child node as it may be used as the root of the render() method.`} \n
\n \n
\n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,GlobalStyle,theme,styled,ThemeProvider,HotelTheme}}>
} }
